txt.en:
'The first thing to be done is to speak with Fastred. He is the Reeve of the Sutcrofts, and a young, brutal leader.

'He may be upset with my father for his actions, but the dangers facing the Sutcrofts are quite real, and sooner or later, he will need to understand that.

'He spends most of his time in the Mead Hall, so you will likely find him there.'

'What business have you with the Reeve, traveller?

'Very well, you may speak with him, but you will have to wait. He is on one of his daily Orc-hunts in the fields.

'He does not like to be interrupted, so in the meantime, you may aid us here should you wish to wait.'
Snowbourn is ruled by Fastred, a young and somewhat brutal Reeve.
Fastred's seat is vacant, but it appears one of his men has remained in the hall
Fastred can be found inside the Mead Hall of Snowbourn.\n\nAfter arriving in Snowbourn, Gísling wants you to speak with Fastred, Reeve of the Sutcrofts, about the perils facing his people.
Léofhelm is inside the Mead Hall of Snowbourn.\n\nFastred is nowhere to be found. Perhaps one of his men will know of his whereabouts.
